docs.title: TaskHub Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to TaskHub, your comprehensive task management solution designed to streamline workflow and boost productivity.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get up and running with TaskHub in minutes. See our Getting Started guide to begin managing your tasks efficiently.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Task Management - Create, organize, and track tasks with ease
  • Collaboration - Share tasks and collaborate with team members
  • Progress Tracking - Monitor task status and project completion
  • Notifications - Stay updated with real-time alerts
  • Integrations - Connect with your favorite tools and services

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
• Getting Started - Installation and initial setup
  • Usage Guide - Learn how to use TaskHub features
  • API Reference - Developer documentation
  • FAQ - Frequently asked questions

docs.title: Support
docs.text: Need help? Check our FAQ or contact support.

docs.title: Version
docs.text:
Current Version: 1.0.0

Last Updated: November 14, 2025

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Get up and running with TaskHub in just a few minutes.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Before you begin, make sure you have: - A valid email address - Internet connection - A modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

docs.title: Step 1: Create Your Account
docs.text:
1. Visit taskhub.app
  2. Click the "Sign Up" button
  3. Enter your email address
  4. Create a strong password (minimum 8 characters)
  5. Click "Create Account"
  6. Check your email for a verification link
  7. Click the link to confirm your email
  8. You're now ready to use TaskHub!

docs.title: Step 2: Complete Your Profile
docs.text:
1. Click your profile icon in the top-right corner
  2. Select "Profile Settings"
  3. Add your full name
  4. Upload a profile picture (optional)
  5. Set your timezone
  6. Choose your preferred language
  7. Click "Save"

docs.title: Step 3: Create Your First Project
docs.text:
1. Click "Projects" in the left sidebar
  2. Click "+ New Project"
  3. Enter a project name (e.g., "My First Project")
  4. Add a description (optional)
  5. Choose project type:
  6. Personal: Only you can access
  7. Team: Share with team members
  8. Public: Anyone with link can view
  9. Click "Create Project"

docs.title: Step 4: Add Your First Task
docs.text:
1. Click your newly created project
  2. Click "+ New Task"
  3. Enter a task title (e.g., "Welcome to TaskHub")
  4. Add a description (optional)
  5. Set a due date (optional)
  6. Set priority: Low, Medium, High, or Critical
  7. Click "Create Task"

Congratulations! You've created your first task.

docs.title: Adding Team Members
docs.text:
1. Click "Team" in the sidebar
  2. Click "+ Invite Members"
  3. Enter team member email addresses (comma-separated)
  4. Select their role:
  5. Member: Can create and edit tasks
  6. Admin: Can manage team and settings
  7. Click "Send Invites"

Team members will receive an invitation email and can join your workspace.

docs.title: Managing Tasks
docs.text:
Update Task Status: 1. Open a task 2. Click the status dropdown 3. Change to: To Do, In Progress, Under Review, or Done

Add Comments: 1. Open a task 2. Scroll to Comments section 3. Type your message 4. Mention teammates using @username 5. Click "Post"

Attach Files: 1. Open a task 2. Click "+ Attach" 3. Select files or drag and drop 4. Files are stored with the task

docs.title: Organizing Your Work
docs.text:
Create Tags: 1. Open a task 2. Click "+ Add Tag" 3. Enter tag name (e.g., "Urgent", "Bug", "Feature") 4. Tags help filter and organize tasks

Filter Tasks: 1. Click the "Filter" icon 2. Select criteria (Status, Priority, Assignee, Tags) 3. View only relevant tasks

Search Tasks: 1. Click the Search icon 2. Type keywords 3. Results appear instantly

docs.title: Dashboard Overview
docs.text:
Your TaskHub dashboard shows:

  • Quick Stats: Task completion overview
  • Recent Tasks: Tasks you recently worked on
  • Assigned to Me: Tasks assigned to you
  • Upcoming Deadlines: Tasks due soon
  • Team Activity: Recent changes by team members

docs.title: Notification Settings
docs.text:
1. Click your profile icon
  2. Select "Settings"
  3. Go to "Notifications"
  4. Choose notification types:
  5. Task assignments
  6. Deadline reminders
  7. Comments
  8. Project updates
  9. Select frequency and channels
  10. Click "Save"

docs.title: Appearance Preferences
docs.text:
1. Go to "Settings"
  2. Click "Appearance"
  3. Choose theme: Light, Dark, or Auto
  4. Adjust sidebar width
  5. Enable/disable animations

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text:
Quick shortcuts to boost productivity:

Shortcut Action Ctrl + N Create new task Ctrl + F Search tasks Ctrl + , Open settings Escape Close dialog ? View all shortcuts

docs.title: For Individual Users
docs.text:
1. Create a personal project
  2. Add tasks for your goals
  3. Set due dates and priorities
  4. Track progress

docs.title: For Team Leaders
docs.text:
1. Create a team project
  2. Invite team members
  3. Create tasks and assign them
  4. Monitor team progress

docs.title: For Managers
docs.text:
1. Set up multiple projects
  2. Invite all team members
  3. Create recurring tasks
  4. Generate reports

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you're set up, explore:

  • Features - Learn about all TaskHub features
  • Usage Guide - Detailed instructions for each feature
  • Integrations - Connect with other tools
  • Best Practices - Productivity tips

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
• Check our FAQ
  • Visit Support Center
  • Email: support@taskhub.com
  • Live chat available in the app

Back to Documentation | Next: Usage Guide

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: Get TaskHub installed and ready to use on your system.

docs.title: Minimum Requirements
docs.text:
• OS: Windows 10+, macOS 10.13+, or Linux (Ubuntu 18.04+)
  • RAM: 2GB minimum
  • Storage: 500MB free space
  • Browser: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge (latest versions)
  • Internet: Active internet connection required

docs.title: Recommended Requirements
docs.text:
• RAM: 4GB or more
  • Storage: 1GB free space
  • Processor: Multi-core processor (Intel i5 or equivalent)

docs.title: Browser Installation
docs.text:
TaskHub works directly in your web browser with no installation required.

  1. Open your web browser
  2. Navigate to https://taskhub.app
  3. Sign up for a new account or log in
  4. Start managing tasks immediately

docs.title: Windows Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the installer from taskhub.app/download
  2. Run TaskHub-Installer.exe
  3. Follow the installation wizard
  4. Click "Finish" to launch TaskHub

docs.title: macOS Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the .dmg file from taskhub.app/download
  2. Open the downloaded file
  3. Drag TaskHub to the Applications folder
  4. Launch from Applications or Spotlight

docs.title: Linux Installation
docs.text:
Ubuntu/Debian:

wget https://taskhub.app/download/taskhub-linux.deb
sudo dpkg -i taskhub-linux.deb
taskhub

Fedora/RHEL:

wget https://taskhub.app/download/taskhub-linux.rpm
sudo rpm -i taskhub-linux.rpm
taskhub

docs.title: iOS Installation
docs.text:
1. Open the App Store
  2. Search for "TaskHub"
  3. Tap "Get" and authenticate with Face ID/Touch ID
  4. Wait for installation to complete

docs.title: Android Installation
docs.text:
1. Open Google Play Store
  2. Search for "TaskHub"
  3. Tap "Install"
  4. Accept permissions and wait for installation

docs.title: Create Your Account
docs.text:
1. Launch TaskHub
  2. Click "Sign Up"
  3. Enter your email and create a password
  4. Verify your email address
  5. Complete your profile information

docs.title: Initial Configuration
docs.text:
1. Set your timezone and language preferences
  2. Invite team members (optional)
  3. Create your first project
  4. Customize notification settings

docs.title: Installation Issues
docs.text:
"File is corrupted" error - Clear your browser cache - Download the installer again from the official website - Temporarily disable antivirus software during installation

"Port already in use" error - Close other applications using the same port - Restart your system - Contact support if issue persists

Installation hangs - Check your internet connection - Try disabling VPN temporarily - Restart the installation process

docs.title: Common Solutions
docs.text:
• Ensure you have admin/sudo privileges
  • Disable antivirus temporarily during installation
  • Update your operating system to the latest version
  • Clear temporary files and try again

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings → Apps → Apps & Features
  2. Find "TaskHub" in the list
  3. Click and select "Uninstall"
  4. Follow the uninstallation wizard

docs.title: macOS
docs.text:
1. Open Finder
  2. Navigate to Applications
  3. Drag TaskHub to the Trash
  4. Empty Trash

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
sudo apt remove taskhub  # Ubuntu/Debian
# or
sudo rpm -e taskhub     # Fedora/RHEL

docs.title: Mobile
docs.text:
• iOS: Long-press the app icon and select "Remove App"
  • Android: Long-press the app icon and select "Uninstall"

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• Check our FAQ
  • Visit Support Center
  • Email: support@taskhub.com

docs.title: Inline Code Block
docs.text: Printf("Hello World!!);

docs.title: Reference Link Example
docs.text: Hello, you can refer [Link text][1]

docs.title: [1]: https://www.google.com
docs.text: Back to Documentation | Next: Getting Started

docs.title: Usage Guide
docs.text: Learn how to effectively use TaskHub to manage your tasks and collaborate with your team.

docs.title: Creating a New Task
docs.text:
1. Click the "+ New Task" button
  2. Enter a task title
  3. Add a description (optional)
  4. Set a due date and priority level
  5. Assign to team members (optional)
  6. Click "Create Task"

docs.title: Task Properties
docs.text:
• Title: Brief name of the task
  • Description: Detailed information about the task
  • Due Date: When the task should be completed
  • Priority: Urgency level (Low, Medium, High, Critical)
  • Status: Current state (To Do, In Progress, Under Review, Done)
  • Assignee: Team member responsible for the task
  • Tags: Custom labels for categorization

docs.title: Create a Project
docs.text:
1. Click "Projects" in the sidebar
  2. Select "+ New Project"
  3. Enter project name and description
  4. Choose project type (Personal, Team, Public)
  5. Click "Create"

docs.title: Organizing Tasks in Projects
docs.text:
• Drag tasks between projects
  • Use folders within projects for better organization
  • Create project templates for recurring workflows
  • Set project privacy levels

docs.title: Updating Task Status
docs.text:
1. Open a task
  2. Click the Status dropdown
  3. Select the new status
  4. Save changes automatically

docs.title: Adding Comments
docs.text:
1. Open a task
  2. Scroll to the Comments section
  3. Type your comment
  4. Press Enter or click "Post"
  5. Mention teammates using @username

docs.title: Attaching Files
docs.text:
1. Open a task
  2. Click "+ Attach" button
  3. Select file from your computer
  4. Or drag and drop files directly

docs.title: Filter Tasks
docs.text:
• Click "Filter" icon
  • Select filter criteria:
  • Status (To Do, In Progress, etc.)
  • Priority (Low, Medium, High, Critical)
  • Assignee
  • Due date range
  • Tags

docs.title: Search Tasks
docs.text:
1. Click the Search icon
  2. Type keywords in the search box
  3. Results update in real-time
  4. Click a result to open the task

docs.title: Save Custom Views
docs.text:
1. Set your filters
  2. Click "Save View"
  3. Name your view
  4. Access saved views from the sidebar

docs.title: Sharing Tasks
docs.text:
1. Open a task
  2. Click "Share" button
  3. Enter team member email
  4. Select permission level (View, Edit, Comment)
  5. Click "Share"

docs.title: Team Comments
docs.text:
• Add comments to collaborate on tasks
  • Reply to specific comments
  • Mention team members with @
  • Pin important comments

docs.title: Activity Timeline
docs.text:
• View all task changes in the activity log
  • See who made changes and when
  • Track task history

docs.title: Setting Preferences
docs.text:
1. Click your profile icon
  2. Select "Settings"
  3. Go to "Notifications"
  4. Configure preferences:
  5. Choose notification types
  6. Select frequency (Real-time, Daily, Weekly)
  7. Pick channels (Email, In-app, SMS)

docs.title: Managing Notifications
docs.text:
• Mute notifications for specific projects
  • Snooze notifications temporarily
  • Mark notifications as read

docs.title: View Reports
docs.text:
1. Navigate to "Reports" section
  2. Choose report type:
  3. Task completion rate
  4. Team productivity
  5. Project progress
  6. Time tracking

docs.title: Export Data
docs.text:
1. Open a report
  2. Click "Export"
  3. Choose format (CSV, PDF, Excel)
  4. Download the file

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text: Shortcut Action Ctrl + N New task Ctrl + F Search Ctrl + K Command palette Ctrl + , Settings Escape Close modal Tab Navigate fields @ Mention user

docs.title: Effective Task Organization
docs.text:
• Use clear, descriptive task titles
  • Add relevant tags for easy filtering
  • Set realistic due dates
  • Break large tasks into smaller subtasks

docs.title: Team Collaboration
docs.text:
• Assign tasks clearly
  • Use comments for context
  • Mention relevant team members
  • Review team workload regularly

docs.title: Staying Productive
docs.text:
• Check your dashboard daily
  • Use filters to focus on priorities
  • Archive completed projects
  • Review and adjust your workflows

docs.title: Task Not Updating
docs.text:
• Refresh your browser (Ctrl + R)
  • Check your internet connection
  • Log out and log back in

docs.title: Notifications Not Working
docs.text:
• Verify notification settings in preferences
  • Check browser notification permissions
  • Ensure your email is verified

docs.title: Sync Issues
docs.text:
• Desktop app: Restart the application
  • Mobile: Force close and reopen
  • Web: Clear browser cache

Back to Documentation | Next: Features

docs.title: TaskHub Features
docs.text: Explore the powerful features that make TaskHub the ideal task management solution for individuals and teams.

docs.title: Create Tasks
docs.text:
• Add tasks with titles, descriptions, and due dates
  • Set priority levels (Low, Medium, High, Critical)
  • Assign tasks to team members
  • Add custom tags for better organization

docs.title: Organize Tasks
docs.text:
• Create custom projects and folders
  • Use drag-and-drop to reorganize tasks
  • Filter tasks by status, priority, or assignee
  • Save custom views for quick access

docs.title: Track Progress
docs.text:
• Monitor task completion status
  • View project progress dashboards
  • Track time spent on tasks
  • Generate productivity reports

docs.title: Team Collaboration
docs.text:
• Share tasks and projects with team members
  • Assign tasks to specific users
  • Add comments and attachments to tasks
  • Real-time collaboration updates

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text:
• Control access levels (View, Edit, Admin)
  • Set team-wide permissions
  • Archive completed projects

docs.title: Real-time Alerts
docs.text:
• Task assignment notifications
  • Deadline reminders
  • Comment mentions
  • Project updates

docs.title: Customizable Preferences
docs.text:
• Choose notification frequency
  • Select notification channels (Email, In-app, SMS)
  • Mute notifications for specific projects

docs.title: Connected Services
docs.text:
• Slack integration for notifications
  • Calendar sync (Google Calendar, Outlook)
  • Email forwarding to tasks
  • Webhook support for custom integrations

docs.title: Analytics & Reporting
docs.text:
• Task completion metrics
  • Team productivity insights
  • Custom report generation
  • Export data to CSV or PDF

docs.title: Automation
docs.text:
• Create task templates
  • Set recurring tasks
  • Bulk task operations
  • Workflow automation rules

docs.title: Cross-Platform Support
docs.text:
• Web application
  • Mobile apps (iOS & Android)
  • Desktop application (Windows & macOS)
  • Offline mode support

Back to Documentation

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Find answers to common questions about TaskHub.

docs.title: How do I create a TaskHub account?
docs.text: Visit taskhub.app and click "Sign Up". Enter your email, create a password, and verify your email address. Your account will be ready to use immediately.

docs.title: Can I use TaskHub without signing up?
docs.text: No, you need an account to use TaskHub. However, you can try the free version with limited features without a credit card.

docs.title: How do I reset my password?
docs.text:
1. Go to the login page
  2. Click "Forgot Password?"
  3. Enter your email address
  4. Check your email for a reset link
  5. Click the link and create a new password

docs.title: Can I have multiple accounts?
docs.text: Yes, you can create multiple accounts with different email addresses. However, you cannot link them together.

docs.title: How many tasks can I create?
docs.text: Free plan: 100 tasks per month. Paid plans have unlimited tasks.

docs.title: What's the difference between a task and a project?
docs.text: A project is a container for organizing related tasks. A task is an individual item of work that needs to be completed.

docs.title: Can I move tasks between projects?
docs.text: Yes, use drag-and-drop or right-click on a task and select "Move to Project".

docs.title: How do I delete a task?
docs.text:
1. Open the task
  2. Click the "..." menu
  3. Select "Delete"
  4. Confirm deletion

Deleted tasks go to trash and can be recovered within 30 days.

docs.title: Can I duplicate a task?
docs.text: Yes, right-click a task and select "Duplicate". The new task will be created with the same properties.

docs.title: How do I set recurring tasks?
docs.text:
1. Open a task
  2. Click "Set Recurrence"
  3. Choose frequency (Daily, Weekly, Monthly)
  4. Set an end date (optional)
  5. Save changes

docs.title: How do I invite team members?
docs.text:
1. Click "Team" in the sidebar
  2. Click "+ Invite Members"
  3. Enter email addresses
  4. Set their role (Member, Admin)
  5. Click "Send Invites"

docs.title: What are the different permission levels?
docs.text:
• View: Can see tasks and projects but cannot make changes
  • Edit: Can create and modify tasks
  • Admin: Full control, can manage team settings and members

docs.title: Can I share a single task with someone?
docs.text: Yes, open the task and click "Share", then enter their email and select permission level.

docs.title: How do I remove a team member?
docs.text:
1. Go to "Team Settings"
  2. Find the member
  3. Click the "..." menu
  4. Select "Remove"

docs.title: Why am I not receiving notifications?
docs.text:
• Check your notification settings in preferences
  • Verify your email is confirmed
  • Check your spam folder
  • Ensure notifications are enabled in your browser

docs.title: Can I disable notifications?
docs.text: Yes, go to "Settings" → "Notifications" and toggle off notification types or select "Do Not Disturb" mode.

docs.title: How do I mute notifications for a specific project?
docs.text: Right-click the project and select "Mute Notifications". You can unmute anytime.

docs.title: Can I attach files to tasks?
docs.text: Yes, click "+ Attach" in a task and select files from your computer, or drag and drop files directly.

docs.title: What file types can I attach?
docs.text: You can attach most common file types: PDF, Word, Excel, images, videos, and more. Maximum file size is 100MB.

docs.title: How do I search for tasks?
docs.text: Click the Search icon and type keywords. Results update in real-time. You can filter by status, assignee, or date.

docs.title: Can I create custom views?
docs.text: Yes, set your filters then click "Save View". Name your view and it appears in the sidebar for quick access.

docs.title: How do I export my data?
docs.text:
1. Go to "Reports"
  2. Select a report
  3. Click "Export"
  4. Choose format (CSV, PDF, Excel)
  5. Click "Download"

docs.title: What are the pricing plans?
docs.text:
• Free: Up to 100 tasks/month, basic features
  • Pro: $9.99/month, unlimited tasks, advanced features
  • Team: $24.99/month, team collaboration, analytics

docs.title: Can I change my plan anytime?
docs.text: Yes, upgrade or downgrade anytime from your "Billing" settings. Changes take effect immediately.

docs.title: Do you offer discounts for annual billing?
docs.text: Yes, annual plans include 20% discount compared to monthly billing.

docs.title: Can I cancel my subscription?
docs.text: Yes, go to "Billing" → "Subscription" and click "Cancel". Your account will downgrade to the free plan.

docs.title: Is there a free trial?
docs.text: Yes, try all Pro features free for 14 days. No credit card required.

docs.title: TaskHub is running slowly. What can I do?
docs.text:
• Clear your browser cache
  • Disable browser extensions
  • Update your browser to the latest version
  • Check your internet connection speed
  • Restart the application

docs.title: I'm getting an error message. What should I do?
docs.text:
1. Note the error code
  2. Refresh your browser or restart the app
  3. Check our Support Center
  4. Contact support with the error details

docs.title: Does TaskHub have offline mode?
docs.text: Desktop and mobile apps have limited offline functionality. Your changes sync automatically when reconnected.

docs.title: Is my data secure?
docs.text: Yes, TaskHub uses 256-bit encryption for all data in transit and at rest. We comply with GDPR and SOC 2 standards.

docs.title: Are there mobile apps?
docs.text: Yes, TaskHub is available on iOS and Android. Download from the App Store or Google Play Store.

docs.title: Can I sync across devices?
docs.text: Yes, all your data syncs automatically across web, desktop, and mobile apps.

docs.title: Does the desktop app require installation?
docs.text: Yes, download the installer from taskhub.app/download and follow the installation wizard.

docs.title: Can I use TaskHub offline?
docs.text: Desktop and mobile apps support offline mode. Changes sync when you reconnect to the internet.

docs.title: What integrations does TaskHub support?
docs.text:
• Slack
  • Google Calendar
  • Microsoft Outlook
  • Webhooks for custom integrations

docs.title: How do I connect Slack?
docs.text:
1. Go to "Settings" → "Integrations"
  2. Click "Connect Slack"
  3. Authorize the app
  4. Choose which notifications to send to Slack

docs.title: Can I integrate TaskHub with my own applications?
docs.text: Yes, TaskHub has a REST API and webhook support. See our API Reference.

docs.title: Still Have Questions?
docs.text:
Can't find the answer you're looking for?

  • Email us: support@taskhub.com
  • Visit our Support Center
  • Contact us via live chat in the app

Back to Documentation
